result.execSummary:
All charges against Duane Lashon Madge Jr. in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Duane Lashon Madge Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Duane Lashon Madge Jr. in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared in court. Defendant now qualifies for SPD and will have an attorney appointed by next hearing. Court finds good cause to waive preliminary hearing time limits. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Duane Lashon Madge Jr. appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by phone. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant is currently not employed. Defendant is referred to SPD. State heard and requests $2500 cash bond. Attorney Kieler heard and requests a lower cash bond amount. Court heard and orders $1000 cash bond, concurrent with 22CF114 and 22CF51. Status date set.
